outputs.output_descr: The purpose of the National HCFC Phase out Management Plan (HPMP) is to develop and implement actions addressed  to eliminate the consumption of HCFCs, (classified as Annex C Group I substances under the Montreal Protocol), in accordance to the  Decision XIX/6 of the  Montreal Protocol Parties. This decision establishes accelerated HCFCs  consumption and production phase out calendars, starting in 2013 with a consumption freeze level equivalent to the  average consumption of 2009 and 2010, followed by a 10% reduction in 2015, and subsequent  staggered reductions up to the total elimination in 2040.

project_descr: The purpose of the National HCFC Phase out Management Plan (HPMP) is to develop and implement actions addressed  to eliminate the consumption of HCFCs.
project_title: BRA/12/G76 - HCFC Phase Out National Programme
